## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r}
filepath="/home/CAMPUS/ecka2018/Climate_Change_Narratives/EmilyKuhn_Santabarbara_data.csv"
climate_data = read.csv(filepath)
head(climate_data)
str(climate_data)
```

## Fixing Dates

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r}
strDates <- as.character(climate_data$DATE)
climate_data$NewDate <- as.Date(strDates,"%Y-%m-%d")

```

## Plot
```{r}
plot(TMAX~NewDate, climate_data, ty='l')
climate_data$Month = format(as.Date(climate_data$NewDate), format = "%m")
climate_data$Year = format(climate_data$NewDate, format="%Y")
MonthlyTMAXMean = aggregate(TMAX ~ Month + Year, climate_data, mean)
MonthlyTMAXMean$YEAR = as.numeric(MonthlyTMAXMean$Year)
MonthlyTMAXMean$MONTH = as.numeric(MonthlyTMAXMean$Month)
str(MonthlyTMAXMean)
plot(MonthlyTMAXMean$TMAX, ty='l')

plot(TMAX~YEAR, data=MonthlyTMAXMean[MonthlyTMAXMean$Month=="05",],
ty='l', xlim=c(1893, 2020))
May.lm <- lm(TMAX~YEAR, data=MonthlyTMAXMean[MonthlyTMAXMean$Month=="05",])
summary(May.lm)

abline(coef(May.lm), col="red")
MonthlyTMINMean = aggregate(TMIN ~ Month + Year, climate_data, mean)
MonthlyTMINMean$YEAR = as.numeric(MonthlyTMINMean$Year)

MonthlyTMINMean$YEAR = as.numeric(MonthlyTMINMean$Year)
MonthlyTMINMean$MONTH = as.numeric(MonthlyTMINMean$Month)
(MonthlyTMINMean)


```


Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
